It is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellowish in color, which bloom during the dry season. Its root system is adapted to nutrient-poor soils, allowing it to thrive in harsh, arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nananthus hilmarii is considered a critically endangered species.
